revised_title: Mechanism and Stereochemistry of Enzymic Reactions in Porphyrin Biosynthesis
tldr: The article discusses the mechanism and stereochemistry of enzymic reactions involved in porphyrin biosynthesis, focusing on 5-aminolaevulinate synthetase. The authors explore two pathways for the initial bond-forming step in the reaction and examine the formation of the two vinyl groups of haem from the propionate residues of the precursor, coproporphyrinogen III. They also study the mechanism of porphyrinogen carboxy-lyase reaction and the action of ALA synthetase.
